text: Mesić (Serbian Cyrillic: Месић, Romanian: Mesici) is a village in Serbia. It is situated in the Vršac municipality, in the South Banat District, Vojvodina province. The village has a Romanian (87.22%) ethnic majority and its population numbering 202 people (2011 census). The village is best known for the Serbian Orthodox Mesić Monastery. ==See also== *List of places in Serbia *List of cities, towns and villages in Vojvodina Category:Populated places in Serbian Banat Category:Populated places in South Banat District Category:Vršac Category:Romanian communities in Serbia
title: Mesić (Vršac)
